servinfo.title: Crank Pin and Connecting Rod Bearings Inspection

ptxt.intxrefpoff: Piston, Piston Ring and Connecting Rod Removal and Installation:For F9Q Engine

servinfosub.title: Crank Pin Diameter
servinfosub.ptxt: Inspect crank pin for uneven wear or damage. Measure crank pin for out-of-round or taper with a micrometer. If crank pin is damaged or out-of round or taper is out of specification, replace crankshaft.

servinfosub.title: Connecting Rod Bearing Visual Inspection
servinfosub.ptxt: Inspect bearing shells for signs of fusion, pitting, burn or flaking and observe contact pattern. Bearing shells found in defective condition must be replaced.

s1.ptxt: Before checking bearing clearance, clean bearing and crank pin.
Install connecting rod bearings referring to Step 3) of “Installation” under Piston, Piston Ring and Connecting Rod Removal and Installation:For F9Q Engine .
Place a piece of gauging plastic (1) to full width of crank pin as contacted by bearing (parallel to crankshaft), avoiding oil hole.

attention3.ptxt: Do not rotate crankshaft while gauging plastic is installed.

s1.ptxt: Install bearing cap referring to connecting rod and bearing cap referring to Step 9) of “Installation” under Piston, Piston Ring and Connecting Rod Removal and Installation:For F9Q Engine .
Remove cap, and using a scale (1) on gauging plastic envelope (2), measure gauging plastic (2) width at the widest point (clearance).
If measured clearance is out of specification, use a new connecting rod bearing.
After install new bearing, recheck clearance.
If clearance can not be brought to its specification even by using a new connecting rod bearing and/or replace crankshaft.
Install piston and connecting rod assembly to cylinder block referring to Step 1) through 9) of “Install” under Piston, Piston Ring and Connecting Rod Removal and Installation:For F9Q Engine .

Using special tool and dial gauge, measure piston protrusion at specified position (2) as shown in figure when piston (1) reaches top dead center. Repeat this procedure with each piston. If measured protrusion is out of specification, proceed to next step.

Check connecting rod length referring to “Connecting Rod and Related Parts Specification (for Reference)” under Cylinders, Pistons and Piston Rings Inspection:For F9Q Engine .If connecting rod is normal, proceed to next step.
Replace piston (1) as follows in order to adjust piston protrusion to specified value.

s2.ptxt: Remove piston, and measure the following specification.

item.ptxt: Distance “c” between top of piston and top of piston pin hole

s2.ptxt: Obtain distance “d” between top of piston and center of piston pin hole by formula below.
Using piston protrusion “a” measured at Step 2), obtain adjusting distance “e” by formula below.
When distance “d” of removed piston is 47.026 mm (1.85142 in.), and measured piston protrusion “a” is 0.45 mm (0.0177 in.)
Calculated adjusting distance “e” = 47.026 mm (1.85142 in.) + 0.56 mm (0.0220 in.) – 0.45 mm (0.0177 in.) = 47.136 mm (1.85575 in.)
Select new piston so that distance “e” is within range of distance “d” of new piston.

attention3.ptxt: Piston class (1) is marked on piston top as shown in figure.
